claim: The person who was last to edit the post with ID 183 performed that edit using a mobile device while connected via cellular data.
extra_info: last to edit refers to MAX(LastEditDate);
reasoning: The claim asserts that the last edit to post ID 183 was made 'using a mobile device while connected via cellular data.' While the database can identify the last editor of post 183 (via LastEditorUserId/LastEditDate), there are no columns or tables in the database that track device type or network connection type. This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA claim — the concepts of 'mobile device' and 'cellular data' do not exist anywhere in the database schema.

content.text:
I'll analyze this claim step by step.

**Step 1: Read the claim carefully.**

The claim states that the person who last edited post ID 183 did so "using a mobile device while connected via cellular data." This references device type and connection type — let me check if the database schema contains such information.

**Step 2: Explore the database schema.**

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE postHistory
(
    Id                INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostHistoryTypeId INTEGER          null,
    PostId            INTEGER          null,
    RevisionGUID      TEXT null,
    CreationDate      DATETIME     null,
    UserId            INTEGER          null,
    Text              TEXT     null,
    Comment           TEXT         null,
    UserDisplayName   TEXT null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
**Step 3: Assess whether the claim is verifiable.**

The claim asserts two specific things:
1. Who last edited post ID 183 (verifiable — the `posts` table has `LastEditorUserId` and `LastEditDate`)
2. That the edit was done "using a mobile device while connected via cellular data" (NOT verifiable)

The database schema contains no columns related to:
- Device type (mobile, desktop, etc.)
- Connection type (cellular data, WiFi, etc.)

None of the tables (`posts`, `postHistory`, `users`, `badges`, `comments`, `postLinks`, `tags`, `votes`) contain any information about the device or network connection used to make edits.

**Conclusion:**

The claim references concepts (device type, connection type) that are entirely **out of schema**. The database has no way to verify whether any edit was performed on a mobile device or via cellular data.

This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA claim — the concepts of 'mobile device' and 'cellular data' do not exist anywhere in the database schema."}
